title: Facebook sorry for branding China's president 'Mr S***hole'
text: Facebook has blamed a "technical error" after it translated the name of China's President Xi Jinping as "Mr S***hole".

title: Facebook Translates Chinese Leader Xi Jinping’s Name With Vulgar Term, Blames Computer Glitch
text: A translation from Burmese to English posts on its platform rendered Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s name to appear as “Mr. S–thole” for a few days.

title: Social Shopping Is Taking Off, and Facebook Is the Biggest Beneficiary
text: The percentage of users shopping directly in social media apps increased 69% last year.

title: Facebook apologises for Xi Jinping offensive name translation gaffe
text: Facebook said on Saturday it was working to find out how Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s name appeared as “Mr Shithole” in posts on its platform when translated into English from Burmese, apologising for any offence caused and saying the problem had been fixed.

title: Hypocrisy is at the heart of Facebook’s refusal to ban false political advertising | John Naughton
text: On 20 December last, Andrew Bosworth, a long-time Facebook executive and buddy of the company’s supreme leader, Mark Zuckerberg, published a longish memo on the company’s internal network.

title: Top Democrats go to war with Facebook and Zuckerberg

title: Wall Street's trillion-dollar club dwarfs Europe Inc
text: With Google parent Alphabet  becoming the latest entrant to Wall Street's trillion-dollar club, Europe's blue-chip companies are dwarfed by comparison -- the most valuable firm from the "old continent", Nestle, is worth just a third of that.

title: Joe Biden slams Facebook, calls Zuckerberg 'a real problem'
text: The Democratic presidential candidate didn't hold back his thoughts in an interview with The New York Times when asked about the social media giant.

title: Facebook Reportedly Decides Against Placing Ads On WhatsApp
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) executives will return to the drawing board to search for new ways to monetize WhatsApp after scrapping plans to sell ads on the chat platform, The Wall Street Journal reported Thursday.

title: Facebook under fire from Pelosi, Buttigieg and others
text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., slammed Facebook during her weekly press briefing Thursday, accusing the company of only caring about profits and saying executives "schmooze" the Trump administration to avoid taxes and antitrust action. Stephanie Mehta of Fast Company and Nilay Patel of The Verge join CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team to discuss.

title: Facebook sued to force Zuckerberg to give up control
text: Four tech firms are suing Facebook in an attempt to get CEO Mark Zuckerberg to relinquish control of the company and sell his majority stake. Yahoo Finance's Dan Howley joins Dan Roberts and Seana Smith on The First Trade to discuss.

title: Cambridge Analytica whistleblower reveals new documents showing how Facebook handled the data misuse scandal
text: Cambridge Analytica whistleblower Brittany Kaiser has released new documents today that suggest Facebook accepted only a simple acknowledgment on email from the firm that it had deleted data associated with 87 million Facebook users’ profiles.

title: Should Facebook Investors Respond More to Antitrust Concerns?

title: Facebook Faces Lawsuit For Alleged Anticompetitive Conduct
text: Facebook, Inc. (NASDAQ: FB) is facing a lawsuit in the U.S. federal court for taking part in alleged anticompetitive activities, according to Reuters.
